Description: Family was not well-off, evidenced by upcycling (e.g., mother altering old clothes, tinned biscuit box use)
Printed with 1980 International Labor Day slogan, used by mother to store sewing needles
Moscow-made vintage watch, required winding three times daily
14-inch black-and-white TV, only received three channels
Third-floor tap had maximum water flow at 7 AM
Newspaper stuffed in door cracks to block cockroaches, with a finger-width gap left—father said it was for 'safe eavesdropping'

1920s three-story apartment at Calle Mercaderes 23, Unit 302; wooden door with iron number plate, yellow peeling walls, creaky cast-iron radiators; Joi's small bed in living room corner, kitchen window facing inner courtyard, storage room piled with old items; iron staircase railing, rusted peanut-carved balcony railings, attic with antique video tapes and projector
Friendly with the bus driver at Route 5 terminal, who liked corn tortillas; Joi could hitch a ride on his 'overtime bus' (personal free ride)
If someone ahead talked over 5 minutes, others would knock on the glass to urge
Watched American films like Music for Millions and Tales of Manhattan via old video tapes at home
Joi often mimicked movie lines in front of the mirror, thought actresses' dresses were 'very pretty'
Textbooks labeled the U.S. as 'imperialist devils,' but Joi developed a fondness for actresses' images, creating a cognitive contradiction
Wrote in the essay Myself in 2049 that she wanted to be an astronaut (as required)
Confided in father that she preferred to be a candy vendor, because 'there would be candy every day'
Mother covered tapes with old towels to prevent dust, and cleaned heads with alcohol swabs before playback
Briefcase usually contained reports, maps, and an American pen traded at a flea market
North Santa Cruz old address: Callejon de la Luz 17, with a tamarind tree behind the house and neighbor Mrs. Maria's vintage color TV

6:30 AM: Woken by milk delivery motorcycle; 7:00 AM: Mother went to work; 8:00 AM: Father went to work, dropped Joi at school; 4:00 PM: After school, bought bread and helped mother shell beans; 7:00 PM: Family dinner after father returned; 9:00 PM: Mother played movies with old video tapes
Liked Ropa vieja (Cuban shredded beef stew), Tamal en hoja (leaf-wrapped corn tamale), Turrón de Coco (coconut nougat)
